quest.name: Dark Days
journal: Drusilla is awaiting word from Arnegis.

Headquarters is relatively quiet while the Lemures continue the work of ascertaining Orcus's whereabouts, until the ever-watchful door guard bursts in, and between ragged breaths delivers the tragic news that Arnegis's body has been found by the Brass Blades. Without a word, Drusilla departs for Erralig's Burial Chamber, leaving her family without a leader. It falls to you to follow, and remind her of the duty she owes to those who yet live.

You find Drusilla at Erralig's Burial Chamber, where she demands the attendant priest allow her to see Arnegis's body. In the face of Drusilla's anger, he agrees to forgo custom─though upon viewing the remains of her comrade, she forbids you from doing the same. Her rage seemingly spent, the reaper explains that there is someone to whom she must speak before returning to headquarters. You are invited to accompany her to Stonesthrow, provided you do so in silence.

In Stonesthrow, Drusilla performs the grim duty of informing Arnegis's wife of his death. Though the woman weeps for him, she speaks with no hint of reproach toward her husband's leader, asking only that he be avenged. Before returning to headquarters, Drusilla requests a word with you out of sight of prying eyes.

Drusilla apologizes for not divulging her prior history with Orcus from the start, and reiterates her commitment to seeing him utterly destroyed. As you express the same, you feel a shiver run down your spine, and turn to see a man with pale skin and sanguine eyes─Orcus himself. Drusilla seizes the opportunity to strike, but Orcus dodges her blow with ease, before fixing you with a ravenous gaze. The slavering fiend describes your soul in uncomfortable detail, proclaiming it the most delicious he has ever seen. Upon declaring his intent to see it suffused with terror and hatred ere he returns to feast, the voidsent vanishes, leaving you and Drusilla alone on the bridge.

Drusilla curses herself for failing to deal Orcus a killing blow then and there. Regaining her composure, she bids you return to Lemures headquarters to discuss your next move.

※In the event that you leave Lemures headquarters, you may re-enter by speaking with the loyal Lemure in Pearl Lane.

In the safety of Lemures headquarters, Drusilla confirms Orcus's words: the voidsent who covets your soul inhabits the body of Drusilla's grandfather, rendered youthful through dark arts. The reaper further explains that Orcus feasts on the souls of those that he kills, absorbing their aether to sate his endless appetite. Although Drusilla is unsure how to proceed, she warns you to take special care as you go about your affairs, for Orcus may be lurking around any corner.

※The next reaper quest will be available from Drusilla upon reaching level 78.
objectives: Speak with Drusilla in front of Erralig's Burial Chamber.
Speak with Drusilla at Lemures headquarters.

dialogue.name: HERMIN
dialogue.text: No word yet from Arnegis, Forename. I've always admired his thoroughness─me, I don't have the patience for that sort of work. That's why he's the brains and I'm the muscle.

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: Apologies, Forename, but we're still waitin' on Arnegis to come through. There's not much for you to do around here until then, unless you have a knack for cleanin'.

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: Hermin is good at wheedlin' out promisin' stories and whatnot, but gettin' to the truth of those stories is a craft as delicate as weavin'. I'm sure you've seen firsthand how one bad bit of information can lead to elaborate plans comin' apart at the seams.

dialogue.name: LEMURESMEMBERA
dialogue.text: Boss! Boss!

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: Calm down, lad. Breathe. What's gotten into you?

dialogue.name: LEMURESMEMBERA
dialogue.text: It's Arnegis! He's... He's been murdered!

dialogue.name: HERMIN
dialogue.text: What!? Tell me I heard that wrong!

dialogue.name: LEMURESMEMBERA
dialogue.text: I'm afraid not. The Brass Blades found him half-buried in the sands not bells ago, just...just lying there like some bloody animal carcass. They're bringing him to Erralig's Burial Chamber as we speak.

dialogue.name: HERMIN
dialogue.text: Whoever did this doesn't know the reckoning they've got coming! Before I'm done with them they'll be begging to crawl back into their mother's womb!

dialogue.name: LEMURESMEMBERA
dialogue.text: I want justice as much as you, Hermin, I do...but it's times like these we need to look to the boss for guidance.

dialogue.name: LEMURESMEMBERA
dialogue.text: As you can see, Forename, emotions are running high. I should stay here until Hermin cools off. Can you let the boss know we're standing by and waiting for her command? Like as not she's gone to pay her respects.

dialogue.name: HERMIN
dialogue.text: It won't be enough to kill who did this, oh no... I'm going to make them scream for the next Calamity to come and end their suffering!

dialogue.name: LEMURESMEMBERA
dialogue.text: I'm not sure how long I can keep Hermin from rushing off to take vengeance. Please, go and find the boss. We need a plan, and I know I'm not the one to make it.

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: Sorry, Forename. I ain't in the mood for chitchat...

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: Where's the bloody keeper!?

dialogue.name: NALDTHALPRIEST
dialogue.text: My lady, prithee... The dead must be let to rest.

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: The dead're goin' to have one more among 'em if you don't shut yer trap and listen! The Brass Blades brought in a body not long ago. Show me to it.

dialogue.name: NALDTHALPRIEST
dialogue.text: Ah, yes, that they did, but are you the deceased's family? If not, I am afraid we cannot─

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: Family? Family!? Arnegis was like a son to me!

dialogue.name: NALDTHALPRIEST
dialogue.text: Like a son...? Ordinarily that would be... Ahem. He is interred in the innermost coffin. However, I must advise you not to gaze upon the body...

dialogue.name: NALDTHALPRIEST
dialogue.text: Mada─ ...Ah. If she insists, then so be it...

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: Godsdammit, Arnegis, I told you not to go and get yourself─

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: ...Don't, Forename. This isn't for you.

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: I'm sorry for bargin' in here and for all the bluster. If you can forgive my rudeness, promise me that Arnegis gets sent off well and proper.

dialogue.name: NALDTHALPRIEST
dialogue.text: Of course he shall be. However, if you wish to inter him within the city gates, well... Such sought-after space comes at no small expense.

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: I don't care what it costs. Just send your man to Lemures headquarters to collect what you require.

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: Forename, I appreciate you comin' to find me, but there's someone else I have to speak with first.

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: I'm headin' to Stonesthrow. Come along if you please, but...come along in silence.

dialogue.name: NALDTHALPRIEST
dialogue.text: The departed must not be looked upon. That is our creed, a sacred rule that must never be broken. We urge all bereaved to follow suit, but sometimes...

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: This is where Arnegis's dear wife earns her livin'. Best get this over with.

dialogue.name: ARNEGISWIFE
dialogue.text: Arnegis never forgot the debt he owed you. The debt we both owed you. Even so, his loyalty ran even deeper than that.

dialogue.name: ARNEGISWIFE
dialogue.text: It's a strange thing, to look back on the people we were. A decade younger and a lifetime more foolish. Young lovers, proud patriots, blissfully ignorant, returning to Locus Amoenus, the cradle of our people...

dialogue.name: ARNEGISWIFE
dialogue.text: A triumphant homecoming for the Garleans after centuries in exile. The once-mighty invaders had been laid low and driven back whence they came, and it was a banner day when Arnegis was honored with a post there.

dialogue.name: ARNEGISWIFE
dialogue.text: The honor and pride quickly faded when we saw the truth of Locus Amoenus. We hadn't just defeated our enemies─we had clapped them in irons and condemned them to a life of servitude.

dialogue.name: ARNEGISWIFE
dialogue.text: Descendants of those who'd driven our ancestors north so many generations ago, made to pay for the crimes of their forebears. His superiors were certainly pleased with the poetry of it all.

dialogue.name: ARNEGISWIFE
dialogue.text: Arnegis, however, could not simply look away from their suffering, let alone take pleasure in it. Confronted with the reality of the place we would call home, his conscience demanded he take action.

dialogue.name: ARNEGISWIFE
dialogue.text: He began cooperating with the resistance, but the eyes of the Frumentarium are all-seeing, and before long he was ousted as a sympathizer. 'Twas only by the grace of good fortune that we escaped with our lives.

dialogue.name: ARNEGISWIFE
dialogue.text: I've often lain awake at night, wondering if he had outlived his usefulness to the resistance. Or perhaps it was a petty senior officer that orchestrated our fall.

dialogue.name: ARNEGISWIFE
dialogue.text: Regardless of the cause, the outcome was the same: we could never return to the Empire. We fled to Eorzea by way of Radz–at–Han, the only route open to us.

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: Wasn't soon after steppin' foot on the docks of Limsa Lominsa that your luck ran out, as I recall. Stopped by Yellowjackets and accused of bein' imperial spies.

dialogue.name: ARNEGISWIFE
dialogue.text: Aye, but we still managed to make an escape. We ran and ran, terrified that our pursuers would one day catch up to us.

dialogue.name: ARNEGISWIFE
dialogue.text: That is, until we met you. Had you not taken us under your wing when you did, I shudder to imagine our fate.

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: Your gratitude's the last thing I deserve, lass. If I hadn't sent Arnegis off on my damned fool's errand, he'd still be alive.

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: It was Orcus that killed him, and no mistake. He died for my vengeance. I can't tell you how sorry I am...

dialogue.name: ARNEGISWIFE
dialogue.text: No, you needn't apologize. I know...I know he was happy. So long as he was helping you, he was happy.

dialogue.name: ARNEGISWIFE
dialogue.text: The blame for his death doesn't rest on your shoulders. It rests on the man─the monster─that murdered him in cold blood, and I expect you to see he answers for this crime. For me, and...for Arnegis...

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: I will, lass. I will. On this I swear everythin' that I have to swear.

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: We need to talk, Forename. Somewhere with fewer pryin' eyes. Come meet me at the bridge to the north.

dialogue.name: ARNEGISWIFE
dialogue.text: My beloved... Would that I could've been by your side...

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: I owe you an apology, Forename. For not tellin' you everythin' about me and Orcus from the start.

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: I dragged you into a fight against a foe that's cunnin', brutal, and utterly merciless. I thought with all of us together, we'd tip the scales in our favor.

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: But I was wrong, and Arnegis paid the price for my hubris.

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: That voidsent we tracked in the Black Shroud was likely one of Orcus's minions, but I was too caught up in my grand scheme to realize it at the time.

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: I should've thought about why it tried to hide that body. Your common voidsent wouldn't have the guile to bury a kill. But what if Orcus taught it that as a way to throw trackers off its scent─and to dangle bait for me and mine?

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: Orcus has used that same trick in the past, and he knows that we know it too. By dispatchin' his minion, we drew his attention. Arnegis was a warnin'.

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: Orcus doesn't give his prey swift deaths. He toys with 'em, cuts into 'em...and savors the screams. That's how I knew he was responsible─it's like a signature, the way he leaves the bodies when he's had his fill. I only pray Arnegis doesn't take that sufferin' with him to the next life.

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: Orcus'll be comin' for you or me next. Not right away, though. That'd be givin' up the game. He wants us to keep lookin' over our shoulders, sleepin' with one eye open. He'll wear us down without even liftin' a finger.

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: And when he finally strikes, we'll be dead on our feet─playthings for him to do with as he pleases. That won't do. We need to bring the fight to him─no more waitin' around for a lead to come to us. It won't be easy, but...can I still count on your help?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: For Arnegis.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I've come this far. Might as well go the rest of the way.

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: ...Thank you, Forename.

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: And if you've got no qualm riskin' life and limb to fight for Arnegis─to fight for me─then I've got no qualm callin' you a member of my family.

dialogue.name: ORCUS
dialogue.text: (-???-)Family... A curious word, that...

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: Bloody─ It's him, Forename! Orcus!

dialogue.name: ORCUS
dialogue.text: Some persistent rats were nibbling at my tail. I should've known by their stench it was you and yours, Drusilla. Or should I call you...

dialogue.name: ORCUS
dialogue.text: ...Granddaughter?

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: Shut your mouth, you thrice-damned monster!

dialogue.name: ORCUS
dialogue.text: Monster? Is that any way to greet a beloved elder? Children these days...

dialogue.name: ORCUS
dialogue.text: It seems one death wasn't punishment enough for you. A second should suffice for this scant remainder of your being...

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: Forename, we're endin' this here and now! Follow my lead!

dialogue.name: ORCUS
dialogue.text: I thought we might savor our reunion for a while longer. But if you insist, I shall feast upon your beating heart here and now!

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: Die!

dialogue.name: ORCUS
dialogue.text: Ah. Naught but dregs left in that desiccated vessel of yours. Too long has the hide been left in the sun...

dialogue.name: ORCUS
dialogue.text: But your “family” has been replenished with fresh blood, I see.

dialogue.name: ORCUS
dialogue.text: My, my, and what a bounteous soul this one has!

dialogue.name: ORCUS
dialogue.text: Your scythe may be dull, but your eye is as sharp as ever.

dialogue.name: ORCUS
dialogue.text: Blinding as the sun, pure as the snow... Heh heh heh...

dialogue.name: ORCUS
dialogue.text: Delectable as a boar slathered in grease!

dialogue.name: ORCUS
dialogue.text: I had thought to make a quick meal of you, but perhaps, just this once, forbearance is in order.

dialogue.name: ORCUS
dialogue.text: Such a singular specimen must be given time to fatten, to fulfill its succulent potential. 'Twould be a travesty to consume you ere you achieve perfection!

dialogue.name: ORCUS
dialogue.text: When your soul is ripe with fear, swollen with hatred, and fit to burst with despair, I shall return for you, Forename. And I shall gorge!

dialogue.name: ORCUS
dialogue.text: Until that time, sup well, my growing whelp!

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: Curse these old bones...he was right in front of me! I could've ended it in one swing!

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: For a moment─just one moment!─I saw it all again. My family, slaughtered, lying at his feet. My life, slipping away... And that was enough.

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: Doubtless you have more than a few questions. I'll answer them, I promise, but now's not the time. Trust me.

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: Standin' around kickin' the sand won't change what's done. Let's return to headquarters and let the wind cool our heads, then we can consider our next course of action.

dialogue.name: HERMIN
dialogue.text: The boss told me everything. That bastard Orcus is going to get what's coming to him. He thinks he knows pain? Well, he hasn't met me!

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: It was my own fault. If I hadn't stood there slack-jawed, if I wasn't so damned slow, we'd be rid of that abomination once and for all.

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: ...What you saw used to be my grandfather, before Orcus took over. He looks green enough to be my own grandchild now. Trick of the void, like as not.

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: It's no secret that if a voidsent doesn't want to devour you, it probably wants to take possession of your flesh, but Orcus has a particular talent for it.

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: And as you doubtless surmised, he's got an insatiable cravin' for aether. Killin' is only a prelude to the act of gulpin' down our essence, like a draught of ale after a day's work.

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: He's old─I can't say exactly how old─and he's acquired a taste for the finer things. Seems your soul counts among the finest he's ever seen. Things just keep gettin' better for us, don't they?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Wouldn't be the first time someone set their sights on my soul.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: He can keep his bloody fangs to himself.

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: Is that so? Used to bein' a prize pig, are we?

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: Heh, truth be told, you don't seem nearly as frightened as I would've thought. Guess it's better to be prized for somethin' than nothin', eh?

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: Anyroad, it's clear that safety is no longer somethin' we can take for granted. Not even in a crowded street, not even in the middle of the day. Keep your eyes peeled, and watch out for those terrible red eyes.

dialogue.name: DRUSILLA
dialogue.text: We're sittin' chocobos for the moment, but I'll think of somethin' and send for you as soon as I can. Until then...never sleep far from your scythe.
